title: why always such bad teammates in team ?
body: everytime i win 1 game i had to try so fking hard to carry bunch of shit. as soon as i boosted some ELO, then super horrible, cant-be-helped-out fucker screws everything up .can u plz improve matchmaking for ranked plz.

replies.body:
Hey there Sulbatamol,

For starters I understand your opinion in regards to the amount effort you are putting into your games in comparison to the lack of effort given by your teammates and commend you for trying "so fking hard to carry". On the other hand I advise that if you want someone to try and help you here you provide a more thought out and less aggressive tone in your post.  

In response to your actual post I don't think Riot can do much about the Matchmaking System as it's basically fulfilling it's purpose as is. May I suggest that you either try finding a duo partner you can **trust** or take a break from ranked and try and recompose yourself. Whilst the latter may seem as a insult saying that it's probably you who is playing poorly. Trust me, I don't mean it that way. I'm simply saying that if you take a break from ranked when you are on a low end of the scale (TILT) then it's best to take a break from it. 

This probably didn't help you much but I wish you the best.
Regards,
Fog

There's nothing wrong with the matchmaking system though, all it does is match people of similar skill levels. I realise that might seem like an insult so let me just assure you, it most certainly is. More often than not when a person is complaining about "bad team mates" they're not much better themselves, they just don't realise it. I've experienced that myself and I'd say it's a pretty safe bet that everyone experiences that at some point. Before placing sole blame on the people you get matched with take a look at the way you play and see how you could improve. If, at that point, you're still finding no luck then there's not much that can be done since it would probably means you're where you belong, or at least close.

Think of it this way: the people you get matched with in a match (both allies and enemies) come from the same pool and are pretty much the same in skill level. Given that there's a higher chance (11.11% more) for the enemy team to get "bad" players than your team, assuming you are more skilled than them. Fact is there's only one common factor between all your games, and that's you.
